Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk docbook-style-dsssl
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: docbook-style-dsssl bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
An updated docbook-style-dsssl package that fixes one bug is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The docbook-style-dsssl package provides Document Style Semantics and Specification Language (DSSSL) stylesheets that allow conversion of DocBook documents to other printed or online formats, such as the Rich Text Format (RTF), PostScript, or HTML.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, the file permissions on the collateindex.pl(1) manual page were incorrect. This could lead to security scanner failures when checking the system settings. The permissions have been adjusted to fix this bug, and security scanners no longer detect violation of the Defense Information Systems Agency Security Technical Implementation Guide (DISA STIG). (BZ#1061759)
Users of docbook-style-dsssl are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
